column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We were given a pager that also includes an app that shows you were you are in line and after approximately 25-30 minutes
column2: we were seated. Our waiter took our order for other items
column3: and we sat salivating and waiting for our first taste of Chicago deep dish pizza. As we sipped on our Italian Margarita's (which are delicious)
column4: the pizza finally arrived. Another waiter cut up the pizza for us and got us all set up. To be honest
column5: the pizza was quite good (the ooey gooey cheese and the sausage)
column6: but I gotta say one of our LA gems of a restaurant might have them beat. That said
column7: we weren't disappointed at all and were glad we could visit this famed Chicago restaurant.
